Question: How did the antagonist confess about the crime?
AnswerText: I stole it from the company, and have been able to keep it so far.

Question: What is the resolution of the crime?
AnswerText: I first stole ten thousand dollars, which was brought to my office on Sunday, by the messenger from Atlanta. I had no right to the package, and should have immediately re-billed it and sent it off. I was certain that no one knew that it had been missent. I never thought I should be guilty of theft till the time

AnswerText: one man who could bring out the robbery

What was the amount of money missing or stolen?
AnswerText: ten thousand dollars in bills

AnswerText: the messenger

Question: What are the details of the evidence?
AnswerText: On the sixth of May, Maroney mailed a letter, which the "shadow" discovered was directed to "William M. Carter, Locksmith, William st., N. Y." A note was taken of this, and as soon as possible Bangs left for New York, to interview Mr. Carter. He found that Carter was one of the best locksmiths in the city, and inclined to be a good fellow

Question: What did the antagonist do after stealing the money?
AnswerText: In a short time I asked for leave of absence to make a visit to the North. It was granted me, and I started off, with the ten thousand dollars in my possession.

Question: Did anyone from the antagonist family knew?
AnswerText: I did not tell my wife a word about it
